Mathew Nik Foscarini <nfoscarini@=
yahoo.com> wrote:
> I tried for 2 days to get it to compile.
> 
> I was nev=
er able to get it to work inside Eclipse. The Maven plugin

for me.

ing
> usable.
> 
> Running "maven install" on the main pom.xml only works i=
f I manually

ven

=

va complaining about missing jar files
> from the local user repository.

> At one point I was able to get Eclipse to compile the code, and run
> He=
ritrix, but only if I used the war file from the release package

ommand line, but after that none of my code changes would

eritrix UI.

nning in an hour.

I dislike maven as much as anybody. But it compiles fine=
 for me. What
java/os/maven version are you using? Could you describe the p=
roblem a
little more? Maven does require a working internet connection to
d=
ownload all dependencies, etc.

I assume that you mean =E2=80=98mvn=E2=80=
=99 - =E2=80=98maven=E2=80=99 is the maven 1 binary.

I would definitely ru=
n mvn from the command line first before I tried
to get it set up in Eclips=
e.

The following sequence works for me:

egh@gales:~/tmp$ ~/software/maven=
-2.0.7/bin/mvn --version

t (build 1.6.0_07-b06)

de, sharing)

ed stuff, etc.

orge.net/svnroot/archive-crawler/trunk/heritrix2

egh@gales:~/tmp$ cd herit=
rix2

egh@gales:~/tmp/heritrix2$ ~/software/maven-2.0.7/bin/mvn install
